meanings.definition: One who anticipates or looks forward to something.
meanings.sent1: The anticipator eagerly awaited the arrival of their birthday.
meanings.sent2: The student was an excellent anticipator, always prepared for class.
meanings.sent3: The little girl was an anticipator of Christmas, counting down the days with excitement.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition was like an anticipator, always sensing what was to come.
meanings.sent5: The anticipator's enthusiasm was contagious, spreading to everyone around them.

meanings.definition: Something that anticipates or predicts future events.
meanings.sent1: The weather vane acted as an anticipator of the upcoming storm.
meanings.sent2: The alarm clock was a reliable anticipator, waking him up at the same time every morning.
meanings.sent3: The old legend spoke of a magical anticipator that could foresee disasters before they happened.
meanings.sent4: The ancient artifact was believed to be an anticipator of great battles to come.
meanings.sent5: The crystal ball served as an anticipator, revealing glimpses of the future to those who gazed into it.
